one_reviews_text:
It's a good way to learn and the idea is definitely there. More lessons would be cool and its a little buggy (like when I speak it thinks I said something else. There's a skip button when needed so it's not too big of a deal). Overall I enjoy it though.
It has a lot of potential and Im excited to see where it goes in the future.

It has some audio issues when outside, sometime multiple sounds going at the sound time.
It recognized your voice about 80% of the time so you will need to repeat a few times.
You do get some pretty good practice so not bad there.

The idea is nice and the game is probably worth it for a few dollars,
but it really needs to be more polished to be good. 
The sentence recognition appears to be a bit broken in Japanese. Sometimes a word is written in Kanji in the example sentence, but then the voice recognition will pick it up in Hiragana or with Arabic numerals instead and count that as a miss. Since the range of acceptable answers are very limited I suspect that there is some kind ''good answers'' list that has to match perfectly and lacks some sentence writing variations.

I have an Oculus Rift S as well as a studio mic, and it has issues telling what im saying sometimes. Seems a bit advanced for beginners, at least in Japanese. Multiplayer is completely empty. Not bad but those issues need addressing.
review_feedback:
Hello, I'm really sorry to hear that you did not enjoy the experience. You can fix the problem by disabling Oculus Virtual Audio Device from sound settings.

Follow the instructions below to do so: 
1. Right click on the speaker icon on the bottom right icon tray. 
2. Click on "Open sound settings". 
3. In the "Input" section, choose "Headset Microphone (Oculus Virtual Audio Device)" as your input device. 
4. Click on "Device properties" 
5. In the pop-up window, tick the checkmark for 'Disable' 
6. Replace your input device in the previous settings window; your microphone should be working and you should be able to enter the scenarios within Mondly VR. We would love to hear the outcome either here or at support@mondly.com. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
So I am a Japanese American fluent in English and Japanese. 
I think this game has HUGE potential, and I am looking forward to the updates in the future!

I am giving 4 stars for the French language, and 1 star for the Japanese language.

I tried French first. I can speak very little French but it was great to learn through the simulation! What I loved about was that it will give you some freedom of answering the questions, and not limited to the choice that shows up on the right-side panel. 
I also gave a try on Japanese. Japanese doesn't give you any freedom. Even all the choices were grammatically wrong (taxi was bad), you will have to say exactly the sentences that are shown on the choice. It's kind of bad that you need to read the wrong Japanese in order to finish your course...
Other than that, I think it's great!
I am going to try German next!
review_feedback: Hi, thank you for your feedback - we have accounted for it. The Mondly VR app is continuously improving and we rely on your feedback when it comes to future updates. Thank you again for your support and all the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: I didn't read the description, i thought it would have same available language than on the website... but after buying and trying i notice that the language im learning is not there...

review_title: Good Start, lessons need more work.
one_reviews_text:
I've only tried the first few Japanese modules so far, I enjoyed the concept but for a new learner an option to learn some gramatic structure and pronounciation would be appreciated.  

The rote memorization and paroting of entire phrases feels limited.   I would love to see a classroom mode with more detailed progressive lessons.

On the techincal side:
 In conversations where a second speaker arrives, often parts of the interface did not move to the new viewing angle.

there were also some interesting scaling problems when transitioning to the cutscenes (everyone got about 25% larger?)
Keep on updating and we will keep on using.

Usisng this to help learn Japanese. Its nice to use this to help practice conversational Japanese. Also this is way easier to do since it is like a game an better then trying to gain the effort to sit in front of a textbook.
review_feedback: Hi, thank you so much for your glowing review and for your kind words - we're happy to have received such amazing feedback. All the best from your friends @Mondly.

one_reviews_text: Vietnamese isn't an easy language to learn (for me anyway) mainly because of the tones used when speaking it, this seems to recognize the tones when I speak during the lessons, forcing me to get it right  (most of the time, it does slip every once in a while.)  FYI: This uses a North Vietanamese accent, and I want to speak with south accent, but it's close enough.  I usually get bored quickly with other language learning apps, but with VR, definitely keeps your interest.  This is a great tool to get started.  Recommended.
review_feedback: Hi there, thank you so much for your kind words and for your support - we're happy to see that you enjoy learning with Mondly and that you keep practicing your Vietnamese. All the best in the new year from the entire Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
I went to a French school as a child and spoke perfect French when I was thirteen but haven’t practiced at all and wanted to brush up. Out of curiosity I tried the beginner level which was easy for me but a newbie would have no idea how to pronounce anything! And several times when I responded with something simple like “nine o’clock” that I learned in kindergarten, it showed the correct answer that I said but the character kept saying she couldn’t hear or understand me. It couldn’t understand “Los Angeles”  even though that was one of the supplied answers. A few times I had to yell my answer several times louder and louder because it kept saying it didn’t hear me because noise was too loud but I was in a perfectly quiet room. My responses showed up written correctly but the AI couldn’t “hear” it. This was with the Quest2 and Oculus link BTW.

The locations were nice and immersive and the AIs were cool (although they all looked pretty similar) which is why I’m giving this three stars but I really don’t see how one could learn a language with this. If I didn’t know how to pronounce things, I don’t see any way I could have figured it out. In French there are many letters at the end of a word that are not said aloud but someone who didn’t know the language wouldn’t know that. 

Also the story had no continuity. In the taxi I chose the career of doctor from the list but then later when someone asked my career, doctor was no longer a choice. When I ordered red wine and a salad at the restaurant, I was given a croissant and coffee. When I asked the taxi driver to take me to the beach, (one of the choices) he took me to a hotel. If this was a choose your own adventure type story with continuity while learning a new language, this would definitely be a great app. 

The concept is great but the execution needs a lot of work.
review_feedback:
Hello from Mondly! Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We're constantly working on improving our speech recognition feature but we might also be limited by the technology available.
We're trying to create an immersive experience, as close as you'd get by visiting a foreign country.
In regards to your suggestions related to our scenes, we'll make sure to take them into account for our next updates - stay tuned. All the best from the Mondly Team!

review_title: Great travel and language learning exp
one_reviews_text: Very fun! You get to travel and be a rude customer in many different languages!
review_feedback:
Hello, thank you for your review. We're happy to hear that you're having fun while learning and travelling a bit! The Mondly personnel is happy to help though :D .
Stay tuned for more updates. All the best, the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: WASTE OF MONEY INSTALLED WORKED FIRST DAY THEN STOPPED WORKING I WISH I COULD GIVE THEM NEGATIVE STAR
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your review. Can you please tell us more about the issue? You can respond either here, updating your review or send an email to support@mondly.com. We would be more than happy to help you. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
this is the worst form of learning a language i have tried 
1. Teaches no grammer or alphabet
2. Has terrible voice reconnition(in german i wasnt able to get it to register the word being said, it would tell me to try again and all that. it only worked if i said it in a hillbilly southern accent (i.e.: Katze woudnt work but "el cat zee" would work everytime)
3. (at least for german) just pernounce everything with a really southern yee haw accent and sound it out in english and it will register but pernounce it in german and it wont reconize 
I dont understand how you can claim that this will teach someone a language but leave somthing so important as grammer and alphabet out.

(edited because the pure ignorance of the developers response shows that they both know that they made a cheep scam of a program to sell and are compliant with it being such a spit in the face of the consumer)
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your feedback. I'm sorry to see that you're not enjoying the Mondly experience. We are recreating real-life experiences in Virtual Reality which translates as the most immersive language - learning process. Pure theoretical grammar rules have not been our main focal point as we're interested into teaching language as natural as possible. We do understand that this might not be what you're looking for. Our voice recognition software is improved day by day. We're looking forward to hearing more details from you at support@mondly.com. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: I love this app and use it regularly to learn Dutch. I've ran into a bug using the Quest 2 with Link cable. I have the Quest 2 mic set as audio input. Mondly will not recognize it. When I switch the input to Windows Default, Mondly still does not recognize it. I have enjoyed this app but the mic calibration issue means I can't access any lessons unless an external mic is plugged in.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your review and for your kind words. We're actively working on fixing this issue and we'll make sure to have it up and running ASAP. All the best from the entire Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
Great app and has very good voice detection. I notice some people are having trouble, but I have a standard gaming headset and it understands me perfectly.

I hope this gets ported to the Quest 2.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your review, we are glad you could fully enjoy the experience. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
Overall, I really liked the game and gameplay. I thought it was an interesting way to supplement learning Japanese and force me to start looking at Kanji. Additionally, I like the 'snail' speak to slow things down. 

For the Japanese part, I thought it would have been cool to be able to turn on / off the Hiragana & Katakana instead of Romaji. Also, be able to turn on / off the Furigana (little hiragana above the kanji) to better assist. As well as give those options for your responses on the right. The general options given on the right didn't have the romaji support, so I had to listen really hard to make sure I knew what they were saying. It would have been nice to have the option to turn those on / off. Maybe there is a way, but I didn't find it.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your kind words and for your support. In regards to the Romaji option, you should be able to see the toggle right above the spoken sentence. If you have any other questions, we'll more than happy to assist, just email us at support@mondly.com. Looking forward to hearing from you! All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
At first I couldn't get the microphone to work with my Oculus Quest 2 (using link). Excellent support from Mondly helped me out. 

The app is not perfect but for the price I paid it's easily 5 star rating for learning languages.
review_feedback: Hello, we are sorry you could not enjoy Mondly VR. Please make sure that in the Windows Oculus app you have "Quest Microphone" for your Quest 2; and in the Windows sound settings, you have "Headset Microphone (Oculus Virtual Audio Device)" selected as your input. Would love to hear more from you either here or at support@mondly.com. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: Brilliant concept and executed incredibly well. Very impressed!
review_feedback: Hi, thank you so much for your glowing review and for your kind words - we're happy to have received such amazing feedback. All the best from your friends @Mondly.

one_reviews_text: This could be a great app for practicing a langauage. I would not say it is so practical for teaching a new language without prior understanding. You can get through the simulation but  you will just learn memorized phrases which is not really learning the langauage, just memorizing. If the microphone were improved this could be a very usueful tool for practice. I speak beginner turkish fairly clearly according to my turkish friend but the microphone in the app could not properly recognize my speech about have the time. It was quite frustrating. This app has great potential if the microphone issue can be fixed.
review_feedback: Hello from Mondly! Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We're constantly working on improving our speech recognition feature but we might also be limited by the technology available. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
Can't wait to see more and more improvements go into this and this concept explode. As someone thats been doing duolingo (Eng-German) fairly heavily (1-2k exp a week for 5-6 weeks) even the initial levels are a little on the deep end of my league (without 'cheating' by using the suggestions). 
I don't have a problem with this though, as someone that only knows one german(language you are learning) speaking friend having the opportunity to speak back and forth like this is invaluable. I can't wait to come back to this in a month with a little more vocabulary under my belt.

One side note the talk-to-text can be a little janky occasionally but thats just as likely the quest microphone. 

Seriously if you are somewhere past absolute beginner (around the point of formming basic sentences that would come up in small talk) in a supported language but lack a real life 'talking' bag, this is game changing and an awesome utilisation of technology.
review_feedback: Hi, thank you so much for your kind words, we're happy to hear that we've managed to immerse you into a German speaking environment. We do have some more updates pending and we hope that you'll enjoy them as much as you've done until now. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: What a great game/ learning experience. I can't wait for more levels and more in depth learn ops. I will be centainly recommending this to people I know with VR. Minor bugs, but a work in progress. I would like to see an exit button in the stages to save progress. I would like to see stages like supermarket, office enviroment , and schools as these are places travelers are likely to go in new/ different countries.  Great experience thanks......what you got next!!!
review_feedback: Hi, thank you for your feedback - we have accounted for it. The Mondly VR app is continuously improving and we rely on your feedback when it comes to future updates. Thank you again for your support and all the best from the Mondly Team!

After receiving helpful, friendly, and fast customer support from a developer I quickly fixed my issue and got right into the game. It was lots of fun and very helpful for learning languages! Very friendly people, and the software was enjoyable and comfortable. Easily a 5/5. I do suggest buying!

A very satisfied Customer!

review_feedback: Hi, thank you for your feedback. We're happy to hear that you're enjoying the Mondly experience, stay tuned because there's more content coming your way. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
First it says, if I have any idea to make it better, I should write the company. Which I also will, but first, I love languages and I can speak already a few. The tutorial is nice and for the first language VR game it is okay. Things that you could have done better is: If they say it once, it doesn't need to be slower. There is no option to listen to it again in normal speed. For languages like japanese, chinese, korean,... if you don't know how to read the signs, you are lost. It only translate in your language, but it doesn't show how to speak the kanji for example. That is really sad. Especially my next goal is to learn chinese, that will be super difficult with this app. Another thing is, it is more luck based if the software understands you. Even if I speak it correctly and it is even written down there correctly, but the app still does not let me pass. The instructor has really bad jokes and sounds more like a robot, but okay. Even there are some mistakes made in there and not everything is perfect, I don't regret that I bought this, but if you can update and make it better, please do so mondly.

Update: Since there was an update, the game has gotten a bit better, but there are still some problems which makes me cringe. Especially in japanese. If I talk and say 分かりました (wakarimashita), it shows it to me in kanji. Not a problem for me, I love kanji, but a problem for the program, since it only allows わかりました. How should I talk the same word without kanji interfering? ^^" I don't know.
review_feedback: Hello, you're right - we do want you to share your feedback with us so thank you for doing so. We've listened and now you can hear the audio on normal speed by clicking the button one more time. We're continuously working on this and we'll soon be looking into the Japanese issue. Stay tuned because we have more goodies for the near  future. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
IT IS AMAZING!
If there were more levels, it would have been EPIC!
100% worth the money. It's actually suprizing how cheap this is compared to how well made this game is!
review_feedback: Hi, thank you for your amazing feedback. We're happy to hear that you're enjoying the Mondly experience, stay tuned because there's more content coming your way. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: Im thinking this its really an great App. Sadly the Learning from Tagalog ( Philipinisch) its be not possible in the same Way how in the App for Smartphone. Im really hopes thats its whoulds getting inside this App too..
review_feedback: Hi, thank you for your feedback. The Mondly VR app is continuously improving and we rely on your feedback when it comes to future updates. We'll do our best to add Tagalog in the future. Thank you again for your support and all the best from the Mondly Team!

review_title: Helps build confidence with language use
one_reviews_text:
I was really pleasantly surprised to find this app so helpful. It gives me a more natural context to use language and associate the phrases with relevant context and situations. I am not embarrassed to make mistakes, repeat phrases, and can learn at my own pace. I especially find the text helpful to reinforce my understanding of spelling and pronunciation. 

As for areas that can be improved, please move the bell location from the hotel desk. My hand continuously triggered it trying to open the dialogue window that it blocked while talking with the concierge. 

I was thrown when speakers change gender and voice mid-phrase. Can you keep the voice of the person you are talking to in each scene consistent? 

Can you consider including pronunciation practice for reading syllables/alphabets as an introduction option before diving into a scene? 

Please include a “rest” option where you can sit in a public space and overhear conversations or background music with translation. I like the idea of taking in language with immersion in a VR space. 

Would also love to see more outcome choices affected by dialogue prompts if possible. Enjoyed my language learning experience a lot and look forward to seeing it develop!

Lastly, please give me an option to set my name as a speaker! Your program keeps trying to force a name assignment on me every time I fill in the blank and it’s extremely frustrating to be called a name I don’t recognize.

Thank you again for the experience and good luck!
review_feedback: Hi, thank you so much for your kind words and for your continuous support. We are beyond happy to hear that Mondly helps you speak with confidence- we promise to keep doing so. All the best from all of us here, at Mondly!

review_title: The game is having some potential.
one_reviews_text:
I am asked what time is it, but there is no clock in the train. How am I supposed to answer. It's bright outside. Currently it's about 2pm here. I said douze heures et demi (12h30). She doesn't understand me. Aparently she likes to hear 9h. It's ok, but please add a clock in order to let us answer that question.

The graphics are sometimes clunky. After the "hello"-session, i was sitting on the floor and suddenly facing a monsterous woman. I don't complain though, because it's about learning after all. However, the environment could be nicer. I was not able to read the stops of the train. And I do think text is in english in all places.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your review. We work with the best speech recognition technology available; I'm sorry to hear about the issue you've encountered. Please rest assured that that they are becoming more and more accurate. As for the surrounding places being in English, we'll make sure to keep it in mind for our next updates. All the best and thank you, the Mondly team.

review_title: Game could not detect any of my mics..
one_reviews_text: I know that my Mics work, i tested all of them i had connected but it just could not detect any. After not being able to fix the issue as there is no in game settings  i just closed the app, a little dissapointed as i was looking forward to learning.
review_feedback: Hello, I'm really sorry to hear that you did not enjoy the experience. You can fix the problem by disabling Oculus Virtual Audio Device from sound settings.Follow the instructions below to do so: 1. Right click on the speaker icon on the bottom right icon tray. 2. Click on "Open sound settings". 3. In the "Input" section, choose "Headset Microphone (Oculus Virtual Audio Device)" as your input device. 4. Click on "Device properties" 5. In the pop-up window, tick the checkmark for 'Disable' 6. Replace your input device in the previous settings window; your microphone should be working and you should be able to enter the scenarios within Mondly VR. We would love to hear the outcome either here or at support@mondly.com. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: it feels similar to speaking to people in real life situations. it can be hard when the app doesnt understand your speech but for the most part I think this is the coolest app to learn a language I’ve found!
review_feedback: Hello, thank you very much for your honest review! We are constantly working on improving the experience and user speech recognition is one of our main concerns. Your feedback is much appreciated! If you have more feedback that you want to share with us,please do write us at support@mondly.com - we'll do our best to implement your suggestions. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: Great program. And a lot of work has been done. Good development team. There were connection problems, but the technical support team helped solve all the problems.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you so much for updating you review. We are thankful for your help and patience in solving this issue. Stay tuned, more updates are on the way. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
I read through some of the other reviews on here, and I suspect that many of those people have never seriously worked on learning a new language. You can read grammar books, and fill in the blanks on your worksheets, but ultimately the biggest step to take is internalizing the language and maintaining a conversation without having to translate back and forth into/from your native tongue in your head. Mondly clearly understands that, and everything about this app seems to be built around it.

First of all, the fact that the entire app is built around conversations is perfect. It gives a context to the language learning process, so we're not rote memorizing random lists of vocab words, but learning how they fit into a conversation. We also have multiple response options, so we can practice saying different things, and move the conversation in a slightly different direction each time we run through it. It's also great that Mondly allows you to take your time, repeat phrases as much as you need to, peek at the translation of each response, hear it in slow motion, etc. Great for pausing and using context to really understand each phrase.

If they wanted to make this a more complete language-learning platform, it might not hurt to have lessons in between the conversation exercises - where we're taken to a classroom, and a teacher explains a concept or grammatical construction, and a few new vocab words. But again - all that stuff, you can get from any conventional language-learning resources. The conversations are what's most important.

Besides this app, the only way to truly pull that off is to be in an in-person class that immerses you in the language on a regular basis, or otherwise to move to the country whose language you're learning, and dive in completely. The language-learning shift takes place on a subconscious level, and so immersion is absolutely necessary to round out the learning process.

I think Mondly should get way more attention than it seems to get.
review_feedback: Hi badsalad, thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback with us and for your amazingly kind words. We're so happy to see that you're placing as much emphasis on immersion on learning languages as we do and we promise that, as time passes, we'll have more content, conversations and scenes. We wish you nothing but the best and a huge thank you from all the Mondly Team.

one_reviews_text: Not a bad game for the first few minutes but when I got to the end of the 2nd module of learning my selected language the game forced me to stop and write a review. I couldnt simply select write a review in game - so I had to leave the VR set up and use my cell to write this for a game that I just purchased. I dont understand the arm twisting logic here as it would have been much friendlier to allow me the option vs holing my game progress hostage and making me write this- I'm sure the frustration is showing as I was in a bit of a zone and thought the game play and progress was working nicely. I hope this gets me back in if not il request a refund for sure.
review_feedback:
UPDATE: Issue is now fixed! Hi,I'm really sorry to hear that. While we do want you to share your experiences and we want to hear all about it - so we'll know where we need work and where we're doing good, we'd never force you to leave a review. 
That was short-lived issue and it will be sorted today. Hopefully, you'll let this pass and you'll stick with us - more updates are due in the future.
All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: Although advertized to have Portuguese (Portugal) it does not seem to be available. I understand some portuguese, and live in Portugal, and find the accent, and even words too diffrent to be useful. Why is it advertised in the Oculus store to be available, if it is not? This is the only reason that I purchased Mondly. Am I missing something?
review_feedback:
Hi,

It seems to be an error on our part. Please ask for a refund.

All the best,
Alex

review_title: Excellent Idea! Fun way to learn
one_reviews_text: Needs a bit of work, but its a cool idea.  This is example of a good thing that VR can bring into the world besides just gaming.  I recommend as a good way to get yourself immersed in a new language, though sometimes whether it was my voice or my microphone, it was not allowing me past certain sections....However its pretty amazing what it can do!  Keep up the good work!  Had a slight issue where Mondly would lock up until you left a review but they addressed it very promptly....Thankyou Mondly for your quick response! +1 star for listening to your public and taking serious your customers' concerns.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your review. We are happy that you enjoyed playing Mondly VR. We are constantly trying to improve the experience and taking our users' concern is utmost important. More updates coming soon, stay in touch. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
I honestly was not expecting much but I am pleasently surprised.  This game puts you in situations where you might want to practice to at least get by in a certain country.  For example, one scene has you checking in at a hotel and it walks you through how to ask for a single room or if you need help with your bags, etc. 

I am not sure how advance it gets but for me that's is pretty good practice and what I am looking for as a traveler.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your review, we are glad you could fully enjoy the experience. Stay in touch, more updates coming soon. All the best from the Mondly Team!

review_title: Fun way to learn a new language!
one_reviews_text:
I really like this it works well i like the way its all laid out and it makes learning the language so much easier. i'm trying to learn German and im really looking forward to how much i learn from it.

Thank you for your respnse, I am really enjoying learning german in this manner. And i can't wait for future updates. Keep up the good work and Danke Gerne for this wonderful game!
review_feedback: Hello, thank you too for your kind review, it means so much for us to hear that you are enjoying the experience and having fun - all while learning - this is what we aim for. Stay tuned, more updates are on the way! All the best from the Mondly Team!

OK, so it's only $3.00 on sale, but that's not the point. It's the disappointment factor. Please respond!!

Check that your input device (the microphone in use) is working in your Windows' settings. It would be great if you could confirm whether everything is fine or not, here or at support@mondly.com.

one_reviews_text:
I am playing with an Oculus Quest via the link. The mic does not work. I have tried using different microphones and nothing works. I have even tried messing with the windows settings to change audio input but it still does not work. This is a broken app. Please fix this ASAP as I love the idea...I just can't use it in its current state.
It might be a good idea to include a Mic check feature so users can see if their voice is being heard or not...would certainly make trying to fix the problem easeir on the user end.
Suggestion: add Hmong as a language! I would happily pay for this feature since it is a difficult language to find classes in. Also maybe include a "just for fun" language like Tolkien Elvish or Klingon just for fun lol. Oh! Or perhaps Latin?
review_feedback:
Hi Tom, thank you for your support. Please make sure that you're choosing the external audio input from your Windows sounds settings and disable the Oculus Virtual Audio Device.
However, from what we know, Oculus has disabled the microphone for Link for the time being but it is supposed to be added back before the end of beta.
We're waiting for more feedback and feature requests from you at support@mondly.com - we'll do our best to follow through.

All the best from the Mondly Team!
Hello, thank you for your review, we are glad you could fully enjoy the experience. Stay in touch, more updates coming soon. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: Nice idea, mediocre exicution.
review_feedback: Hi, thank you for your feedback. Sorry to see that you're not entirely fond of the experience. Would you be so kind as to detail more about it, either here or via support@mondly.com? We'd really like to see what we can do about it and I'm sure we will do our best to meet your needs. Looking forward to hearing from you. All the best from the Mondly Team!

review_title: Best way to Learn a language!!
one_reviews_text:
My wife and I love to travel and we’ve tried several language phone apps that didn’t really help much. There’s something about the way vr immerses that really helps you remember! 

A big thanks to this developer for this incredible tool! 

And I’m loving the latest update! Having different subjects and visuals to go along with it, is incredible!!👍👍
And now that the Quest/Link mic is working I’m going to spend allot more time in this app!
review_feedback: Hello, thank you too for your kind review, it means so much for us to hear that you are enjoying the experience and having fun - all while learning - this is what we aim for. Stay tuned, more updates are on the way! All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: This is an amazing app.  The enviroments are great, the interactions are realistic and I truly enjoy the way I am able to learn by actually speaking the language. It is also fun!  If you are interested in learning a new languange this is a great investment.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your review, we are glad you could fully enjoy the experience. Stay in touch, more updates coming soon. All the best from the Mondly Team!

review_title: intro too long, no explanation of answer
one_reviews_text:
This app is annoying the hell out of me within the first 10 mins and I am going to return it and get a refund. The intro takes far too long and can't be skipped - I really don't want to see me packing my suitcase, boarding the plane and going through the train station every time I switch the game on. 
I chose Spanish to learn. One of the first few things to say was "pleased to meet you". As possible answers there is "encantada" or "encantado de conocerte". Now why is one with an "a" and one with an"o"? I'm guessing it depends on whether the speaker is male or female, but I want an explanation before I choose! Absolutely useless. 

And I can't find a button to let me listen to what I just recorded. How am I supposed to know how it sounded?

So poor...I'll be sticking to my mosa lingue phone app.
review_feedback: Hi, thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback, this is why we'll add the option of skipping the intro in the future updates. As for the language-in-use explanations, we will try to meet these request as Mondly progresses. We focus on delivering a real experience and we get better as time passes. We're happy to hear that you found an app suited to your needs and hope you'll try us again the future. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
This game is so troll i don't regret the money spent on it because it made me laugh
How ever if you're seriously looking for a tool to learn new languages avoid this thing the recognition on the voice is messed up and it's not making the difference between you talking vietnamese or english u spend 30 mins trying to get two words understood properly
review_feedback: Hi, I'm really sorry you feel this way. This is one of the first reports received on voice-recognition not functioning so please send us an email with more details on the matter at support@mondly.com - we'll be more than happy to look into this for you. All the best from the Mondly Team!

review_title: Good start. Looking forward to more!
one_reviews_text:
Only Episode 1 has been released of the Japanese section I took, but I enjoyed immersing myself in VR for a more engaging learning environment. Speaking to the digital avatars made me feel like I was using knowledge in a real-life context. Instead of speaking as I would in a classroom setting (slower, more methodical, but less natural), I found myself speaking as if I would to another person.

In the future I'm hoping for...
*Faster reaction time: I disliked waiting five-to-ten seconds just to try again when I failed to respond correctly. It stacks easily.
*Being tested on identifying what symbols in my learning language mean.
*Account-integration with my mondly account: I have mondly on mobile and it's a great app. The leveling system on their helps me gauge my progress.
*Much more content. The $4 I paid on sale price was more than worth the one episode, but covering the entire Mondly curriculum would be awesome. Obviously it's going to take more time to develop more content though.
review_feedback:
Hello, thank you so much for your review and support. We have 8 conversation scenes and other 6 vocabulary lessons (the latter depend mostly on the combination of languages you choose).
We have accounted for your suggestions and we'll do our best to have them in the oncoming versions of our app.
If you need any assistance or you'd like to let us know of more suggestions, please get in touch at support@mondly.com - we're happy to hear them.
All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: The developers have improved this quite a bit since I last used. This is a great way to start learning another language.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you so much for your support - it means a lot to us that you enjoy the latest updates. Stay in touch, more updates are coming soon. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
I really like this. Whenever I've tried to speak languages, I always feel a bit stressed and often forget vital things in real situations.

This really makes you feel like you're there and the ideas, language, options and settings really put you on the spot. I have only run through it once so far, but this is honestly the most fun I've had learning languages (And realising how bad I am!) that I've had.

Wonderful idea and certainly worth the money. What a fantastic experience. I hope that they keep adding to it and add additional stuff.

5 stars from me!
review_feedback: Hi, thank you so much for your kind words and for your continuous support. We are beyond happy to hear that Mondly helps you speak with confidence - we promise to keep doing so. All the best from all of us here, at Mondly!

one_reviews_text: I wouldnt say this is the best for learning the very basics of wording and understanding of a new language, however it is great for practicing scenarios with easy phrasing.
review_feedback: Hi, thank you for your feedback - we're glad to hear that you're enjoying the experience. However, we'd love to hear more about any features that you'd like to see implemented in the app as we're getting ready more content, get in touch at support@mondly.com. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
I am just getting started with this and it looks go so far.

My suggestion is to add a way to hear what was captured so you can compare your pronouciation to what is expected.
review_feedback: Hi, thank you so much for your feedback. We're always improving the app based on your suggestions so we've recorded your input and soon we will start implementing it. For more feedback or suggestions, please write us either here or at support@mondly.com. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: Microphone not detected. Tested my microphone and works fine; tried different microphones... nothing.
review_feedback: Hello, I'm really sorry to hear that you did not enjoy the experience. You can fix the problem by disabling Oculus Virtual Audio Device from sound settings.Follow the instructions below to do so: 1. Right click on the speaker icon on the bottom right icon tray. 2. Click on "Open sound settings". 3. In the "Input" section, choose "Headset Microphone (Oculus Virtual Audio Device)" as your input device. 4. Click on "Device properties" 5. In the pop-up window, tick the checkmark for 'Disable' 6. Replace your input device in the previous settings window; your microphone should be working and you should be able to enter the scenarios within Mondly VR. We would love to hear the outcome either here or at support@mondly.com. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text: once properly calibrating the microphone it has its success.  my biggest complain is, I wish it would show me what i said in my selected language and not the one i am trying to learn.  This way i can see what i said and what i did wrong.  even if it showed in the spoken version of the language and not in that countries alphabet.  I have a hard time figuring out if I am saying something properly and the mic is having an issue or if it is my pronounciation.  overall to the team keep it up and thanks for this!
review_feedback: Hello, we are glad you were able to enjoy the experience! Your feedback  was noted, stay tuned, updates coming soon. All the best from the Mondly Team !

one_reviews_text: Fantastic!   I'm 63 and never thought voice recognition would get this good.  Now, buying this is not going to instantly teach you 50 languages.  But if you're learning one or two it's a great asset.   Or, you can use it to get an overview of all the languages offered.    You'll still need books, notebooks and recordings but this will be a HUGE help.   Definitely the future or VR learning!

It always recognizes some other things, something i never said. So i thought i am not saying it right. I let my Girlfriend try it (She is a native speaker), but even then it records something completely different. Total waste of money
review_feedback: Hello, I'm really sorry to hear that you did not enjoy the experience. Will you please give us more details about the issue you encountered at support@mondly.com so we can look into it and sort it out? We are trying to improve the experience and your feedback is valuable. All the best from the Mondly Team!

Starts and then just gets stuck on , screen , KEEP QUIET CALIBRATING MICROPHONE.

using quest , on Link .
review_feedback:
Hello, thank you for your feedback. To fix the microphone issue please follow the instructions below:
1. Make sure you have the latest software installed on both your Quest device and your PC.

We'd love to hear more from you either here or at support@mondly.com. All the best from the Mondly Team!

one_reviews_text:
So far there is not much content and you can't call it a course to learn a language.
It's more a collection of random vowels and conversations. No learning path.

There are also some issues that deserve attention e.g. when i'm asked in the train conversation what time it is, the app understands what i say ("Neuf heures") but writes it differently ("9h") and count it as an error. So to go on, i have to skip this part.

All in all i've waited for an app like this to learn a language and it is much more fun to do it in VR than reading a book. But there is much work to do to make this an app i can recommend.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your review - stay tuned because we're always working towards improving our apps. All the best, Ioana, Customer Care

one_reviews_text:
Programs like these have a lot of potential in Vr. Especially helping people to overcome their awkwardness of being new to a language. It offers quite a few languages in 8 scenarios
But a few things to keep in mind: The phone app of this is more extensive. The go version costs half from what i saw but I'm not sure if the content is exactly the same.
The navigation is simplistic and the speech registers well (At least for me. Other people might run into issues.)
However some translations are fairly rough, you get repeats/similar type of answers and questions in the same dialogue, the difficulty is not very high (basically just some tourist situations) while difficult at the same time: non-roman alphabet letters have no phonetics or roman pronunciation like in google translate. And its not offering a whole lot (yet?) will there be future free or purchaseable lessons? I'm also not sure if people will actually memorize the words and sentences properly like this there should be more memorizing exercises like in the phone app. Vocabulary trainer. Anything.
I hope this or similar programs get developed further in future.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We now have the Latin transcript available. Stay tuned for more goodies to come in the future! If you have any other feedback for us, do get in touch at support@mondly.com. All the best, Ioana, Customer Care.

review_title: A great start for a VR Langue App
one_reviews_text:
I'm studying Japanese, so I've only tried the Japanese scenarios -- I can only speak about those experiences.

It's got a lot of potential, and I sincerely hope the developers hone this app futher.

I'd love to see further developments to emulate having an actual tutor, (I've studied with a RL tutor a few years ago and found it very helpful).  'Cause at the moment it throws you into conversational experiences without going over foundation materials first, (eg: the Kana "alphabets" that the expected responses are written-in).

I was surprised by the voice recognition.  When asked my profession, I replied "Artist" (in Japanese,) and the recognition got that correct.  However, the app was not built to recognize that as a valid response.  It did recognize "student" (also in japanese) which was off-script WRT the responses, but the app did recognize that as a proper response.

I look forward also to users getting involved in the user-to-user practice.  (When I visited the chat room, it was totally empty.)

I'm quite surprised that the app didn't impliment some form of ELIZA.  (And I hope the devs read this and make it happen.)  With how good the speech recognition is, it should be simple to make a "real feeling" chat-bot even if they don't update the scripts that powered the ELIZA version from the '60s.

To sum-up:
It's got a HECK of a lot of potential.
I understand that it's a huge undertaking to do this.
What they've got in place is a great framework and first step toward a fantastic application of VR as a learning tool.
At the moment, it costs the same as a latte from Starbucks and this app is infinetely more helpful than anything I've ever gotten from Starbucks.
I hope the devs are heartened by the response they are receiving and continue to develop this app into the learning environment I know it can be!

review_title: Kanji and Kana mix up for Japanese
one_reviews_text:
There are a lot of prompts that ask for numbers or even just basic phrases that are often spelt out in kana instead of kanji. For example Numbers will be in Kanji in the prompt but when you speak the recognition software puts in the alphanumeric and not the kanji, moreover the prompt will have わかりました in a larger phrase (ex: わかりました．ありがとうございました) but the recognition will input the kanji equivalent of wakaru (分かる) making it mismatch and frustrating.
The app is great for getting your toes wet and start speaking. Sometimes you have to really exaggerate pronunciation but it's still pretty ok. I suggest adding the option of furigana for kanji because swapping between romaji and kana gets frustrating when you know hiragana and katakana but not enough kanji.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you so much for your suggestions- we'll do our best to follow through. If you have any other feedback for us, do get in touch at support@mondly.com- we rely on you. All the best, Ioana, Customer Care

one_reviews_text: Robot voices over lapped with more robot voices.
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for your review. In most of the content - focusing on the conversations, we rely only on native speakers. However, we appreciate your concerns, so it would be great if you could follow this up with us at support@mondly.com. Looking forward to hearing from you, Ioana, Customer Care.

one_reviews_text: I wanna Bulgarian language also pleasee

I would love to learn a language this way.  This game needs some serious love as far as realism in the vocabulary part, and I'd really like some speed settings for how quickly they talk.  Some better audio equipment and voice acting would be nice.  But the whole theory of the game, I love it.
review_feedback:
Hi and thanks for the feedback. 
Speed control coming next week. 
Cheers!

one_reviews_text:
Once you get over the initial strangeness of the voice-samples changing between different people (they do sound like actual native speakers though which is good) it does get quite immersive and you do feel you have to make the effort to pronounciate correctly (without the pressure of doing it in front of people)! I can see this being a great framework to learning - top idea by the developers, I hope they build on the scenarios and content!

I dropped on star as I couldn't find any options around volume settings (it was very loud) or a way to check the mic volume. It took a few goes to realise I had to hold down the oculus controller button to get it to record/listen to my voice. Hopefully this will be considered in a future release if development continues!

After the first part of going to the zoo and supermarket, the next part "Conversations" I get nothing from here? no voice and no clues on what to say the microphone does nothing? nice sitting in a train though
quite frustrating....
review_feedback: Hello, thank you for the feedback! One of our servers was down for a few hours. The issue is now fixed! We hope you'll enjoy our app.

review_title: For what this is it's ok.
one_reviews_text: This is actually kind of fun, I've been learning Japanese personally and it was interesting to see what it was like. I passed the lessons ok. So then I wanted to check out the English version to see actually how good this thing is.  It had me in hesterics. The taxi simulation you had 3 different people speaking for 1 sentence even a gender swap.   The hotel room scene isn't really realistic I would never complain as much as that.  But for what this its ok I wouldn't use this to start learning but as I've used other tools and I've been learning for a while combined with everything else its ok. I was streaming when I did the Japanese and English you see the moment where 3 different people speak as the Taxi driver. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=guBb1r1eKkc
review_feedback: Hello, thank you so much for your support. Happy to let you know that we've sorted out the gender-swap issue. If you have any other feedback for us, do let us know at support@mondly.com. Looking forward to hearing from you, Ioana, Customer Care.

Like it on my holo deck, with X-plane and other programs.
